docTitle.name: shortTitle
docTitle.content: Conservation of Antarctic Marine Living Resources (Toothfish Catch Documentation Scheme) Regulation

subsection.def: CDS (產品證書制度) means the Catch Documentation Scheme for Dissostichus spp. implemented by the Commission for tracking the movement of toothfish items;
CDS document (制度證書) means a DCD, DED, DRED or any other document generated, validated and completed by using the e-CDS;

CM10-03 (《10-03措施》) means Conservation Measure 10-03 adopted by the Commission for port inspections of fishing vessels carrying AMOs, as revised or substituted from time to time and as applied to Hong Kong;
DCD (產品證書) means a Dissostichus catch document;
DED (出口證書) means a Dissostichus export document;
despatching vessel (原載船隻), in relation to a transhipment of a non-landed toothfish item, means the vessel from which the item is transhipped;

Dissostichus catch document (犬牙南極魚產品證書) means a document that—(a)is generated by using the e-CDS; and(b)contains information relating to the harvest, transhipment and landing of Dissostichus spp. as described in CM10-05;
Dissostichus export document (犬牙南極魚出口證書) means a document that—(a)is generated by using the e-CDS; and(b)contains information relating to the export of Dissostichus spp. as described in CM10-05;

Dissostichus re-export document (犬牙南極魚再出口證書) means a document that—(a)is generated by using the e-CDS; and(b)contains information relating to the re-export of Dissostichus spp. as described in CM10-05;
DRED (再出口證書) means a Dissostichus re-export document;
e-CDS (網上系統) means the web-based application implemented by the Commission to support the CDS for the generation, validation, completion and storage of documents under the CDS;
export licence (出口許可證) means a licence granted under section 12(1);
fishing vessel (漁船) means a fishing vessel within the meaning of CM10-03;
import licence (進口許可證) means a licence granted under section 11(1);
licence (許可證) means—(a)an import licence;(b)an export licence; or(c)a re-export licence;
non-landed toothfish item (未上陸犬牙魚產) means a toothfish item that is not indicated by the e-CDS to have been certified as landed, within the meaning of CM10-05, by a competent authority of a place;
receiving vessel (接魚船隻), in relation to a transhipment of a non-landed toothfish item, means the vessel to which the item is transhipped;
re-export licence (再出口許可證) means a licence granted under section 12(2);
toothfish (犬牙魚) means any fish that belongs to Dissostichus spp.;
toothfish item (犬牙魚產) means any toothfish (live or dead), including any flesh or other part (whether raw, or in any way processed or preserved) of any toothfish;

transhipment (轉船), in relation to a non-landed toothfish item on a vessel—(a)means the transfer of the item from the vessel directly to another vessel, whether at sea or in port; but(b)does not include the act mentioned in paragraph (b) of the definition of unload,and tranship (轉船) is to be construed accordingly;

unload (卸下), in relation to a non-landed toothfish item on a fishing vessel, means—(a)unloading or transferring the item in Hong Kong, in any form, from the vessel to dockside, whether or not the item is subsequently transferred to another vessel; or(b)offloading or transferring the item in Hong Kong, in any form, in port from the vessel to a container vessel.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to bringing a toothfish item into Hong Kong includes causing the item to be brought into Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to taking a toothfish item out of Hong Kong includes causing the item to be taken out of Hong Kong.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a non-landed toothfish item on a fishing vessel that enters Hong Kong waters.
A person must not import a toothfish item except under and in accordance with an import licence.

Subsection (2) does not apply to a toothfish item if the item is covered by a valid DED or DRED that indicates that the item is destined, from a place outside Hong Kong, for another place outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: If required by an authorized officer, a person who imports a toothfish item must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce the import licence that covers the item to the officer for inspection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the item falls within subsection (3), produce the DED or DRED mentioned in that subsection to the officer for inspection.

subsection.content: A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 1 year.
A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Unloading non-landed toothfish items from fishing vessel

subsection.content: A non-landed toothfish item that is not covered by a valid DCD must not be unloaded from a fishing vessel.

If a non-landed toothfish item is unloaded from a fishing vessel, the master or the owner of the vessel must, if required by an authorized officer, produce the DCD that covers the item to the officer for inspection.

If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) is contravened in relation to a non-landed toothfish item on a fishing vessel, the master and the owner of the vessel each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 1 year.
A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Taking toothfish items out of Hong Kong

subsection.content: A person must not take a toothfish item out of Hong Kong except under and in accordance with an export licence or a re-export licence.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to a toothfish item if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the item is a non-landed toothfish item and—

subparagraph.content: is covered by a valid DCD;
was transhipped in Hong Kong; and
is taken out of Hong Kong by the relevant receiving vessel after the transhipment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the item is covered by a valid DED or DRED that indicates that the item is destined, from a place outside Hong Kong, for another place outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: If a toothfish item that is taken out of Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: falls within subsection (2)(a), the master or the owner of the relevant receiving vessel must, if required by an authorized officer, produce the DCD that covers the item to the officer for inspection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: falls within subsection (2)(b), the person who takes the item out of Hong Kong must, if required by an authorized officer, produce the DED or DRED mentioned in that subsection to the officer for inspection; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: neither falls within subsection (2)(a) nor falls within subsection (2)(b), the person who takes the item out of Hong Kong must, if required by an authorized officer, produce the export licence or re-export licence that covers the item to the officer for inspection.

subsection.content: A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 1 year.
A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
A non-landed toothfish item that is not covered by a valid DCD must not be transhipped in Hong Kong.
A non-landed toothfish item that is not covered by a valid DCD must not be transhipped outside Hong Kong if a Hong Kong vessel is the despatching vessel or the receiving vessel.

If a non-landed toothfish item is transhipped in Hong Kong, the master or the owner of each of the despatching vessel and the receiving vessel must, if required by an authorized officer, produce the DCD that covers the item to the officer for inspection.

If a Hong Kong vessel is the despatching vessel or the receiving vessel in a transhipment of a non-landed toothfish item outside Hong Kong, the master or the owner of the vessel must, if required by an authorized officer, produce the DCD that covers the item to the officer for inspection.

subsection.leadIn: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (1) is contravened, each of the following persons commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 1 year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the master of each of the despatching vessel and the receiving vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the owner of each of the despatching vessel and the receiving vessel.

subsection.content: If, without reasonable excuse, subsection (2) is contravened in relation to a Hong Kong vessel, the master and the owner of the vessel each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 1 year.
A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Personal baggage
section.leadIn: Sections 3 and 5 do not apply to a toothfish item that is in the accompanied personal baggage of a person entering or leaving Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the item is for the person’s personal use or is a gift to another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total net weight of all toothfish items in the baggage does not exceed 15 kg.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Persons in transit
section.leadIn: Sections 3 and 5 do not apply to a toothfish item that is in the accompanied personal baggage of a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enters Hong Kong via the Hong Kong International Airport from a place outside Hong Kong and then leaves Hong Kong via the Hong Kong International Airport; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: while in Hong Kong, does not pass through any immigration control between the entry time and the leaving time.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Articles in transit
section.content: Sections 3 and 5 do not apply to a toothfish item that is an article in transit as defined by section 2 of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60).

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), sections 3 and 5 do not apply to a toothfish item that is an air transhipment cargo.

subsection.leadIn: If at any time between the item’s being brought into and taken out of Hong Kong, the item is removed from the air cargo transhipment area (other than for its being taken out of Hong Kong by an aircraft)—

subparagraph.content: the item is deemed to be imported, at the time of the removal, by the person who brought the item into Hong Kong as an air transhipment cargo; and
except to the extent mentioned in subparagraph (i), that section applies to the item; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 5 applies to the item.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under section 3(5) or 5(4) in relation to a toothfish item mentioned in subsection (2) (defendant) to show that the defendant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: took all reasonable steps and exercised reasonable diligence to avoid the removal mentioned in that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: did not know, and had no reasonable ground for believing, that the removal had occurred.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5) applies if the defence under subsection (3) involves an allegation that the offence was committed due to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: another person’s act or default; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the defendant’s reliance on information given by another person.

subsection.leadIn: The defendant may not, without the leave of the court, rely on the defence under subsection (3) unless, at least 10 days before the hearing of the proceedings, the defendant has served a written notice on the prosecutor giving the particulars of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the alleged act, default or information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person who is alleged to have committed the act or default or given the information,

subsection.continued: of which the defendant is aware at the time of service.

subsection.leadIn: The defendant may not rely on the defence under subsection (3) because of the defendant’s reliance on information given by another person unless the defendant shows that the reliance was reasonable in all the circumstances, having regard in particular to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the steps that the defendant took, and those which might reasonably have been taken, for verifying the information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the defendant had any reason to disbelieve the information.

subsection.def: air cargo transhipment area (機場轉貨區) means the cargo transhipment area of Hong Kong International Airport as defined by section 2 of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60);
air transhipment cargo (航空轉運貨物) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Import and Export Ordinance (Cap. 60).

subsection.leadIn: On application in the specified form, the Director may grant a licence to the applicant for importing a toothfish item if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the item is covered by a valid DED or DRED that indicates that the item is destined, from a place outside Hong Kong, for Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application fee prescribed in column 3 of item 1 of the Schedule is paid.

subsection.content: For making a decision under subsection (1), the Director may request the applicant to provide further information or other documents to support the application.

subsection.leadIn: On application in the specified form, the Director may grant a licence to the applicant for taking a toothfish item out of Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the item is covered by a valid DCD; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application fee prescribed in column 3 of item 2 of the Schedule is paid.

subsection.leadIn: On application in the specified form, the Director may grant a licence to the applicant for taking a toothfish item out of Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the item is covered by a valid DED or DRED that indicates that the item was destined, from a place outside Hong Kong, for Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application fee prescribed in column 3 of item 3 of the Schedule is paid.

subsection.content: For making a decision under subsection (1) or (2), the Director may request the applicant to provide further information or other documents to support the application.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Licence: Form, Conditions, Refusal of Application and Cancellation

section.name: s13
section.heading: Form of licence
section.leadIn: A licence is to be in a form specified by the Director, and must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the licence holder;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expiry date of the licence; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the conditions, if any, attached under section 14(1).

subsection.content: The Director may attach conditions to a licence.
If, without reasonable excuse, a condition attached to a licence is contravened, the licence holder commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may refuse an application for a licence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any information provided by the applicant is incomplete or incorrect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant fails to comply with a request made under section 11(2) or 12(3); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: granting the licence would be inconsistent with the Convention or any Conservation Measure.

subsection.content: If the Director decides to refuse an application for a licence, the Director must give a written notice to the applicant stating the decision and the reason for the decision.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may cancel a licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the request of the licence holder;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a condition attached to the licence under section 14(1) is contravened;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Director is satisfied that the licence was granted as a result of a false representation of any fact made by the applicant or an unlawful act of the applicant;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if a CDS document submitted in support of the application for the licence is no longer valid; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if granting the licence was inconsistent with the Convention or any Conservation Measure.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director decides to cancel a licence, the Director must give a written notice to the licence holder stating the decision and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the effective date of the cancellation.

subsection.content: If a licence is cancelled, the licence holder must surrender the licence to the Director within 14 days after receipt of the written notice.
A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicant is aggrieved by a decision of the Director to refuse an application for a licence under section 15(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a licence holder is aggrieved by a decision of the Director—

subparagraph.content: to attach a condition to a licence under section 14(1); or
to cancel a licence under section 16(1)(b), (c), (d) or (e),

subsection.continued: the applicant or licence holder may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board against the decision.

subsection.content: If the appeal is against a decision to attach a condition to a licence, the condition is not to be cancelled or varied pending the determination of the appeal by the Administrative Appeals Board.

If the appeal is against a decision to cancel a licence, the appeal does not suspend the decision pending the determination of the appeal by the Administrative Appeals Board, and accordingly does not affect the operation of section 16(3) and (4).

division.name: D3
division.heading: Offence Relating to CDS Document or Licence

section.name: s18
section.heading: Alteration, etc. of CDS document or licence prohibited

subsection.content: A person must not alter, obliterate, deface or render illegible a CDS document or licence.
A person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
